required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Whitening Efficacy of Dentifrice Containing 10% High Cleaning Silica, 0.5% Sodium Phytate and 0.5% Sodium Pyrophosphate
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Commercial Dentifrice Containing 10% High Cleaning Silica Base, 0.5% Sodium Phytate and 0.5% Sodium Pyrophosphate on Tooth Whitening: A 8-week Clinical Study in Adults in China

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the present study was to compare the effects of a commercially available dentifrice containing 10% high cleaning silica base, 0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate versus a negative control dentifrice on removal of extrinsic stains.

detailed_description.textblock: There is great concern on the tooth esthetics and color among people, especially young adults. Great efforts have been made in order to improve patients' smile. Epidemiological studies have reported that dissatisfaction with tooth color ranged from 19.6% to 65.9%, depending on different population. An oral health related quality of life questionnaire for use among young adults reported that tooth color was the most important concern. This dissatisfaction with tooth color has been shown to be associated with increased desire for treatments that improve dental aesthetics including tooth whitening dentifrices. Tooth whitening products generally help to improve the overall whiteness of teeth, by removing and controlling the formation of extrinsic stains. In recent years the interest on the treatment of tooth stain with various tooth whitening agents, among which dentifrice containing high cleaning silica is widely used.

primary_outcome.measure: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Extent Scores 4 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
primary_outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The index measures the area and intensity of extrinsic tooth stain on the facial and lingual surfaces of the lower anterior teeth and facial surfaces of the upper anterior teeth. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain; 1=Light stain(yellow to light brown or gray); 2=Moderate stain(medium brown); 3=Heavy stain(dark brown to black).

primary_outcome.measure: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Area Scores 4 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
primary_outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The index measures the area and intensity of extrinsic tooth stain on the facial and lingual surfaces of the lower anterior teeth and facial surfaces of the upper anterior teeth. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain detected; 1= stain covering up to 1/3 of the region; 2= Stain covering >1/3 to 2/3 of the region; 3=Stain covering >2/3 of the region.

primary_outcome.measure: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Composite Scores 4 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
primary_outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale and the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. Lobene Stain Index: Composite for each part is the product of the stain area and intensity scores. The minimum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 0 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 0. The maximum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 9 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 3.

primary_outcome.measure: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Extent Scores 8 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
primary_outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The index measures the area and intensity of extrinsic tooth stain on the facial and lingual surfaces of the lower anterior teeth and facial surfaces of the upper anterior teeth. For each part, the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain; 1=Light stain(yellow to light brown or gray); 2=Moderate stain(medium brown); 3=Heavy stain(dark brown to black).

The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain detected; 1= stain covering up to 1/3 of the region; 2= Stain covering >1/3 to 2/3 of the region; 3=Stain covering >2/3 of the region.

primary_outcome.measure: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Composite Scores 8 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
primary_outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale and the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. Lobene Stain Index: Composite for each part is the product of the stain area and intensity scores. The minimum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 0 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 0. The maximum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 9 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 3.

arm_group.description: Use the toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base,0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks
Use the negative control dentifrice to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base, 0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate
intervention.description: Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks
Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 18-70 years old
- Good general health
- Could attend the clinical examinations during the 8 week study period
- Possessing >20 natural permanent teeth that were uncrowned or heavily filled with restorative materials, excluding third molars
- Having a whole-mouth mean tooth stain score of more than 1.5 according to the Lobene index.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe oral diseases, chronic disease or allergic to the trial products
- Advanced periodontal diseases
- Females who are pregnant or lactating
- Taking part in other clinical trials
- Taking part in orthodontic treatment or wearing removable denture
- Fluorosis or tetracycline teeth
- Receiving prophylaxis during the previous 3 months or tooth whitening treatment during the past 6 months.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Toothpaste Containing Effective Ingredients
group.description: Use the toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base,0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks Toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base, 0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate: Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks

group.title: Negative Control Toothpaste
group.description: Use the negative control dentifrice to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks Control toothpaste: Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks

group.description: Use the toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base,0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks Toothpaste containing 10% high cleaning silica base, 0.5% sodium phytate and 0.5% sodium pyrophosphate: Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks

group.title: Negative Control Toothpaste
group.description: Use the negative control dentifrice to brush teeth twice daily for 8 weeks Control toothpaste: Use the toothpaste to brush teeth twice a day for 8 weeks

measure.title: Lobene Stain Index: Area
measure.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The index measures the area and intensity of extrinsic tooth stain on the facial and lingual surfaces of the lower anterior teeth and facial surfaces of the upper anterior teeth. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain detected; 1= stain covering up to 1/3 of the region; 2= Stain covering >1/3 to 2/3 of the region; 3=Stain covering >2/3 of the region.

measure.title: Lobene Stain Index: Intensity
measure.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The index measures the area and intensity of extrinsic tooth stain on the facial and lingual surfaces of the lower anterior teeth and facial surfaces of the upper anterior teeth. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. 0= No stain; 1=Light stain(yellow to light brown or gray); 2=Moderate stain(medium brown); 3=Heavy stain(dark brown to black).

measure.title: Lobene Stain Index: Composite
measure.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. The tooth surfaces were divided into two parts: body and gingival. For each part, the stain area was assessed using 0-3 scale and the stain intensity was assessed using 0-3 scale. Lobene Stain Index: Composite for each part is the product of the stain area and intensity scores. The minimum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 0 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 0. The maximum score for Lobene Stain Index: Composite is 9 when both the stain area and intensity scores are 3.

outcome.title: Lobene Stain Index of Stain Extent Scores 4 Weeks After Dentifrice Use
outcome.description: Tooth stain of the anterior teeth were measured using the Lobene Stain Index. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
